name: Vegan Minestrone Soup
description: Better than Olive Garden Vegan Minestrone Soup! Loaded with vegetables, pasta, beans and a rich broth, this hearty soup is made in 1 pot and ready in about 30 minutes.
recipeIngredient: 15 ounce can small white beans, drained and rinsed
15 ounce can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1/2 cup frozen cut green beans (or fresh)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, celery, carrots and zucchini and saute for 5-10 minutes, until the vegetables are a bit tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, celery, carrots and zucchini and saute for 5-10 minutes, until the vegetables are a bit tender.

recipeInstructions.text: To the pot, add the diced tomatoes and their juices, vegetable broth, dried herbs (oregano, thyme, basil), white beans, kidney beans, green beans and pasta. Stir. Bring to a boil, then lower heat the heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the pasta is cooked.
recipeInstructions.name: To the pot, add the diced tomatoes and their juices, vegetable broth, dried herbs (oregano, thyme, basil), white beans, kidney beans, green beans and pasta. Stir. Bring to a boil, then lower heat the heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until the pasta is cooked.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the spinach and let it wilt. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the spinach and let it wilt. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with a loaf of crusty bread, if desired, and sprinkle each bowl with a little fresh parsley and vegan parmesan.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with a loaf of crusty bread, if desired, and sprinkle each bowl with a little fresh parsley and vegan parmesan.
